title: About the Creation of this Package
text: package already used called inline documentation, .e. shortly described functions arguments means special comments directly source code. function header, example, looked like : give title function (just name function, readAndPlotAutoSamplerFiles, description direcly behind three comment characters, ###. example reveals lazy give good title description. Instead, just used name function . , ### case always directly following definition argument, document meaning arguments function. , example good model lacks description last argument, evtSepTime. using package “inlinedocs” convert comments R documentation files. Roxygen another system allows generate documentation special comments source code. Roxygen evolved quasi-standard inline documentation supported Development Environment RStudio, converted inlinedocs comments Roxygen comments. purpose used script toRoxygen.R Subversion control subfolder RScripts/_OTHERS/. conversion, header function looked (almost) like : documentation snippets now altogether comment code block directly function. block, comments start #' indicates special comments interpreded Roxygen. block starts title function. converter script used original “title” just name function conversion put new, somehow meaningful title, “Read Plot Autosampler Files”. Roxygen supports keywords, called tags, start @ character. example @param tag used indicates description argument (parameter) function following.
code: readAndPlotAutoSamplerFiles <- function # readAndPlotAutoSamplerFiles ### readAndPlotAutoSamplerFiles (   filePaths,   ### full path(s) to ORI Auto sampler log files PN_<yyyymmdd>_<station>.csv   removePattern = "Power|Bluetooth|Modem|SMS|Sonde",   ### regular expression pattern matching logged actions to be removed before   ### plotting. Set to "" in order not to remove any action   to.pdf = TRUE,   ### if TRUE, graphical output is directed to PDF   evtSepTime = 30*60 ) {   # Here comes the body of the function } #' Read and Plot Autosampler Files #'  #' @param filePaths full path(s) to ORI Auto sampler log files #'   PN_<yyyymmdd>_<station>.csv #' @param removePattern regular expression pattern matching logged actions to be #'   removed before plotting. Set to "" in order not to remove any action #' @param to.pdf if TRUE, graphical output is directed to PDF #'  readAndPlotAutoSamplerFiles <- function(   filePaths,   removePattern = "Power|Bluetooth|Modem|SMS|Sonde",   to.pdf = TRUE,   evtSepTime = 30 * 60 ) {   # Here comes the body of the function }

what: Call Functions in Base Packages with their Package Name
title: About the Creation of this Package
text: ran “Check” package, got notes case calling functions base packages “utils” “graphics”. corresponding note reads like following: put utils:: graphics:: front function calls notes disappeared.
code: * checking R code for possible problems ... NOTE plotAutoSamplerActions: no visible global function definition for   ‘axis’ Undefined global functions or variables:   axis Consider adding   importFrom("graphics", "axis") to your NAMESPACE file.

title: About the Creation of this Package
text: good practice organise code terms functions. order avoid code duplication, allow reuse existing code improve readability code also good practice split code within functions sub-functions. may result lot functions sub-functions. developer’s point view may say: functions better, given fact good interfaces meaningful names. However, user package confronted full bunch functions. Therefore, top-level functions sub-functions “exported” package, .e. made availalble user calling library(). original version, package kwb.dswt respect recommendation exported functions following line NAMESPACE file: wanted change behaviour using Roxygen tag @export Roxygen headers functions exported let Roxygen generate NAMESPACE file instead manually maintaining file. arose following question: functions package (ever ) used script outside package? fact, question thoughts answer motivated write vignette. (hopefully) propose small script finds functions package called set given scripts. comes script uses functions wrote scope project research data management, FAKIN. need packages kwb.fakin kwb.code installed. Install GitHub :
code: exportPattern(".*") remotes::install_github("kwb-r/kwb.fakin") remotes::install_github("kwb-r/kwb.code") # Set the path to the root folder containing the scripts to analyse root <- "~/HAUKE/R_Development/RScripts"  # Read all scripts below this root folder tree <- kwb.code::parse_scripts(root = root)  # How many scripts were read? length(tree)  # Check which functions from kwb.utils are used and how often usage <- kwb.fakin::get_package_function_usage(   tree, package = "kwb.dswt", simple = FALSE )  # Show the table of function usage usage #>     X                                  name count explicit implicit #> 1   1                  getLevelFilesForSite    18        0       18 #> 2   2                       DSWT_FILE_TYPES     9        0        9 #> 3   3                  DSWT_DICTIONARY_FILE     8        0        8 #> 4   4                      getDswtFilePaths     8        0        8 #> 5   5                    getHQSeriesFromCSV     4        0        4 #> 6   6           readAndPlotAutoSamplerFiles     4        0        4 #> 7   7                               dswtdir     3        0        3 #> 8   8                        DSWT_H_OFFSETS     3        0        3 #> 9   9                        keyFields_DSWT     3        0        3 #> 10 10 prepareSingleVariableDataValuesForOdm     3        0        3 #> 11 11                         .siteNameToDN     3        0        3 #> 12 12                      dirUploadedFiles     2        0        2 #> 13 13                      DSWT_RAIN_GAUGES     2        1        1 #> 14 14                            DSWT_SITES     2        0        2 #> 15 15                       DSWT_TIMESERIES     2        0        2 #> 16 16                 addTotalVolumeAndMaxQ     1        0        1 #> 17 17            DSWT_BWB_CODE_TO_SITE_CODE     1        0        1 #> 18 18                    getLevelFilesInfo2     1        0        1 #> 19 19            insertLocalDateTimeColumns     1        1        0 #> 20 20               insertUtcDateTimeColumn     1        1        0 #> 21 21                     readAllLevelFiles     1        0        1 #> 22 22                        reformatEvents     1        0        1 #> 23 23                       toLevelFileInfo     1        0        1 #> 24 24             validate_HQ_relationships     1        0        1 #> 25 25                   writeEventListToCSV     1        0        1 #> 26 26                    writeHQSeriesToCSV     1        0        1

title: R Package for the Project DSWT
text: installing latest release R package run following code :
code: # Enable repository from kwb-r options(repos = c(   kwbr = 'https://kwb-r.r-universe.dev',   CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Download and install kwb.dswt in R install.packages('kwb.dswt')  # Browse the kwb.dswt manual pages help(package = 'kwb.dswt')

title: Get H and Q Series from CSV File — getHQSeriesFromCSV
code: getHQSeriesFromCSV(   srcfile,   DN,   sep = "\t",   timeFormat = NULL,   hoffset = 0.02,   addTimeColumns = TRUE,   additionalColumns = c("I_mA", "Battery_V"),   ... )

title: Get H and Q Series from CSV File — getHQSeriesFromCSV
text: srcfile full path csv file generated radar probe DN DN mm. Must one 150, 300. sep column separator. Default: Tabulator "\t" timeFormat format timestamp. Default: "%d.%m.%Y %H:%M" hoffset level offset subtracted measured level order get level flume addTimeColumns TRUE, time columns containing local date time added additionalColumns names additional columns imported. One c("I_mA", "Battery_V", "DeviceID") ... arguments passed readLogger_Ori_MLog, e.g. stopOnMissingColumns

title: Get H and Q Series from CSV File — getHQSeriesFromCSV
text: data frame columns BerlinDateTimeNoDST (daylight   saving time adjustment!), Hraw_m (measured height m), H_m (corrected height [= measured height minus offset] m),Q_L_s (calculated discharge L/s). addTimeColumns TRUE columns  BerlinDateTime UTCOffset added.
